page.title: 02HOW PENSBY HAS CHANGED-CONT
page.content: There was no motorised transport either.They could either walk or ride bikes.The children had to walk to the school in Barnston because there was no school in Pensby.They took a bucket to school and they collected water from the Well near by on their way home.On Fishers Lane there was a farmhouse,a few pig sheds and acres of fields full of corn. A bullfight would take place every year on Fishers Lane.Now there is only one field and many houses and shops. The streets have changed too. Electric lamps have been installed and the roads improved for motor traffic. Where as years ago the people had to walk everywhere, they can now use many different forms of transport. The old folk say that Pensby has changed to the better especially as they can get around more easily.
